required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Moderate to Severe Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Hospitalized Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Moderate to Severe Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) in Hospitalized Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Investigational medications adjunct to clinical standard of care treatment will be assessed to evaluate safety and effectiveness as an anti-COVID-19 treatment. All hospitalized persons with moderate to severe COVID-19 disease that meet eligibility criteria will be offered participation.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical status of subject at day 15 (on a 7 point ordinal scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Status on an ordinal scale assessed daily while hospitalized and on days 15 and 29 and 180.
Length of time to clinical improvement
secondary_outcome.description: Time to clinical improvement is defined as the time to normalization of respiratory rate, fever, and oxygen saturation, and alleviation of cough within 72 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with normal pulmonary function and normal O2 saturation on days 11, 15 and 29
Number of participants that developed Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS) after treatment
Length of time to clinical progression
secondary_outcome.description: Time to clinical progression, defined as the time to death, mechanical ventilation, or ICU admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) score, daily while hospitalized and on days 15 and 29. (Initial, highest, deltas and mean)
Length of time to normalization of fever
secondary_outcome.description: Fever normalization as defined by: Temperature < 36.6 °C armpit, < 37.2 °C oral, or < 37.8 °C rectal sustained for minimum 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of time to normalization of oxygen saturation
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen normalization as defined by: peripheral capillary oxygen saturation (Sp02) > 94% sustained minimum 24 hours.

other_outcome.measure: Global and SARS-CoV-2-specific immune responses before, during and after intervention and in standard of care treatment arm
Percent of subjects with SARS-CoV-2 detectable in blood at days 3, 5, 8, 11, 15, 29 and 180.
Quantitative SARS-CoV-2 viral load in blood at days 3, 5, 8, and 11, 15, 29, and 180.

intervention.description: Baricitinib 2 mg po daily for 10 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- Moderate to severe COVID-19 associated disease as defined by the WHO
- Hospitalized patient
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent prior to performing study procedures
- Has laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection as determined by PCR, or other commercial or public health assay
- Illness of any duration, and at least one of the following: Radiographic infiltrates by imaging (chest x-ray, CT scan, etc.), or Clinical assessment (evidence of rales/crackles on exam) AND SpO2 ≤ 94% on room air, or Require mechanical ventilation and/or supplemental oxygen.
- Febrile defined as temperature ≥ 36.6 °C armpit, ≥ 37.2 °C oral, or ≥ 37.8 °C rectal documented within 48 hours of consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in any other clinical trial of an experimental treatment for COVID-19
- Concurrent treatment with other agents with actual or possible direct acting antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 is prohibited < 24 hours prior to study medication initiation
- SOFA >10
- Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > 5 X upper limit of normal (ULN)
- Stage 4 severe chronic kidney disease or requiring dialysis (i.e. eGFR < 30)
- Pregnant women or women who are breastfeeding
- Immunocompromised patients taking medication upon screening
- Consideration by the investigator, for any reason, that the subject is an unsuitable candidate to receive study treatment
